answerText: Plutarch[10] This 2nd century Greek author was a political prisoner in Rome where he tutored Scipio Aemilianus and chronicled the rise of Rome in his Histories, which contain an important description of Hannibal's invasion of Italy.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Chicago A  | 10 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name some things related to Greek historians who wrote about Rome, for 10 points each: [10] While this man's extant works include his On the Malice of Herodotus and his Moralia, he is most famous for his Parallel Lives which pairs its biographies of Alexander the Great and Julius Caesar.
